abstract.p: Compassion and Choices of New York executive director David C Leven letter on June 10 editorial on legislation pending in New York State Legislature supports passage of Family Health Care Decisions Act

block.p: Re ''Two More Weeks'' (editorial, June 10): A critical bill left off your list of those the Legislature should address before it recesses is the Family Health Care Decisions Act. If the bill is passed, loved ones could make health care decisions for those who lose the ability to do so.

Re ''Two More Weeks'' (editorial, June 10): A critical bill left off your list of those the Legislature should address before it recesses is the Family Health Care Decisions Act. If the bill is passed, loved ones could make health care decisions for those who lose the ability to do so.

The importance of this bill is clear. With 155,000 annual deaths in this state, too many people are dying who cannot make health care decisions for themselves and, in the absence of a health care proxy, others cannot generally make those decisions either. Since a large majority of our citizens do not have a health care proxy, many people, patients and family members, are suffering, as health care decisions are not being made in accordance with the patient's wishes or best interests.

The differences between the Assembly and Senate bills must be resolved and a compromise bill must be enacted. Having been stalled in the Legislature for over a decade, it is time to pass the Family Health Care Decisions Act. Good deaths are at stake.
David C. Leven Executive Director, Compassion and Choices of New York Pelham
